org.apache.xpath

Class XPathCollationSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.xpath.XPathCollationSupport

  • public class XPathCollationSupport
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides, collation (used for, string comparison and sorting of strings) support for XalanJ's XPath 3.1 implementation.

      int compareStringsUsingCollation(java.lang.String str1, java.lang.String str2, java.lang.String collationUri)

      int[] getCodepointsFromString(java.lang.String str)
      Given a string, get a corresponding primitive integer array of the codepoints of all the characters of the string in order.
      java.text.Collator getUCACollatorFromCollationUri(java.lang.String collationUri)
      This method implements, 'Unicode Collation Algorithm' as specified by XPath 3.1 F&O spec (which in turn is based on UTS #10 [Unicode Technical Standard #10 : Unicode Collation Algorithm]).

    • Method Detail

      • compareStringsUsingCollation

        public int compareStringsUsingCollation(java.lang.String str1,
                                        java.lang.String str2,
                                        java.lang.String collationUri)
                                 throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
        This method, compares two string values, using a specified collation.
        Parameters:
        str1 - the first string
        str2 - the second string
        collationUri - collation uri
        Returns:
        the string comparison result represented as an integer value. The value -1 indicates that string 'str1' collates before string 'str2', the value 1 indicates that string 'str1' collates after string 'str2', the value 0 indicates that string 'str1' is equal to string 'str2'.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

      • getCodepointsFromString

        public int[] getCodepointsFromString(java.lang.String str)
        Given a string, get a corresponding primitive integer array of the codepoints of all the characters of the string in order.

      • getUCACollatorFromCollationUri

        public java.text.Collator getUCACollatorFromCollationUri(java.lang.String collationUri)
                                                  throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
        This method implements, 'Unicode Collation Algorithm' as specified by XPath 3.1 F&O spec (which in turn is based on UTS #10 [Unicode Technical Standard #10 : Unicode Collation Algorithm]).
        Parameters:
        collationUri - the requested collation uri, during XPath 3.1 string comparisons, and sorting of strings.
        Returns:
        a configured Java object of type java.text.Collator, that callers of this method can use to do locale specific string comparisons.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
